text: <@U08ERPTQF|paul_xbt> has joined the channel

purpose: ideas how to get content in and out of Datt
text: <@U08ERPTQF|paul_xbt> set the channel purpose: ideas how to get content in and out of Datt
<@U08EZP01H|darrenm> has joined the channel
<@U08E5P0BZ|georgevaccaro> has joined the channel
<@U07GDL0H5|ryanxcharles> has joined the channel
on "getting content into and out of datt" ... if you're using a web app, should be easy to switch to <http://OtherDattNode.com|OtherDattNode.com> and authenticate and still have your data
of course we could conceivably autopost stuff elsewhere, or autoimport things.
and of course if you're running your own node, all your data is there. even in the web app, your data should be stored client-side in IndexedDB.
other types of integrations are e.g. twitter or facebook login.
i think twitter would be easy ... just sign a statment and post it to your twitter feed, like keybase.
Agree content is pervasive across different client implementations until the ephemeral drop off
autoimport is an interesting concept. didn't reddit start by posting the type of content they wanted to attract?
"getting data out of Datt" I was thinking more of the SEO or webspider use case
Could that be a revenue stream itself?
<@U08EZP01H>: for sure most sites start with a bootstrap of content that is currently popular on one of it's competitors
it could be a service offered by certain nodes, they may both cache and expose crawler friendly post content for a small fee
Oh that's cool. Make it a value add. If our model is to build 'Content Node 1', that's low hanging fruit with network effects.
Down the road we could expand on the concept by letting nodes value-add storage at a competitive $/GB
Or bandwidth.
:thumbsup:
